Indonesian
**Indonesian** is the official language of Indonesia, spoken by over 280 million people. It's a standardized form of Malay, used as a common language in the many islands of Indonesia. While most Indonesians also speak local languages, Indonesian is used in schools, government, and media. It has words from various regional languages and foreign languages like Arabic, Dutch, and English. In Timor Leste, Indonesian was the official language until 1999 and still has a special status. The term "Bahasa Indonesia" is the full name, with "Bahasa" meaning "language" in Indonesian.
title: Indonesian language
